Grealish debuts for Everton in loss at promoted Leeds in Premier League
arts.sum: Grealish entered in the 71st minute when the score was 0-0 at Elland Road and struggled to make an impact before Leeds was awarded a penalty when Everton captain James Tarkowski blocked a goal-bound shot with his left arm as he leaned his body toward the ball. Everton manager David Moyes was unhappy at the awarding of the penalty, saying ‚Äúit wasn‚Äôt fair‚Äù because Tarkowski‚Äôs arm wasn‚Äôt in an unnatural position.

arts.ttl: Daniel Farke hails Lukas Nmecha‚Äôs ‚Äòice-cold finish‚Äô in Leeds‚Äô win over Everton
arts.sum: The summer signing, a free transfer from Wolfsburg, held his nerve to bury his 84th-minute spot kick.

arts.ttl: Leeds United 1-0 Everton: Post-Match Leeds United Player Ratings
arts.sum: Stach was fantastic offensively and defensively similar to Tanaka, he was winning the ball back, 4 defensive recoveries, 5 clearances when Leeds were under pressure, all whilst being the most creative player in the match, creating 4 chances for his teammates. Defensively no other player won as many duels as Gudmundsson, winning 7 in the match accompanied with 4 clearances and 2 interceptions.

arts.ttl: Leeds United 1-0 Everton: Everton Player ratings
arts.sum: The Senegalse blazed a shot well over the bar in the second-half and broke up play on numerous occasions but struggled to get on the ball and build Everton out of dealing with the pressure that was thrown at them. The game was settled by a contentious penalty decision as James Tarkowski was penalised for handball, which was then dispatched by Nmecha to break the deadlock to hand Leeds the three points.

arts.sum: All the pre-season preparations paid off for Leeds United in their win against Everton on Monday night. The Whites became the second newly promoted team this gameweek to record a win. Sunderland recorded a shock win as they beat West Ham 3-0 at home. arts.ttl: Everton defender James Tarkowski slams officials after Leeds United penalty decision
arts.sum: It is quite a rare occurrence for newly promoted clubs to win their opener in the Premier League, but Leeds United did. They followed the lead of fellow promoted club Sunderland from this weekend. Going into the game, all the talk was about Daniel Farke and him asking for quality in attack for this season.
